intro: Leonohebe mooreae, commonly known as the Moore's leonohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. This herbaceous perennial is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat.
